title: Between 1 July 2017 and 30 June 2018, will an armed group from Bangladesh engage in a campaign that systematically kills 1,000 or more civilians in Bangladesh?
preds: Bangladesh is being stressed by the arrival of large numbers of Rohingya from neighboring Myanmar. This will have a destabilizing affect over the next 6 months.

Rohingya refugees (Muslim) from Myanmar are crossing the border into Bangladesh (400,000+) .  Myanmar (Buddhist) has been persecuting these people and has placed landmines along the borders to discourage escape.  The refugees arrive in Bangladesh hungry, weakened, sick, injured, missing body parts from the landmines.  Limited resources to house and care for the refugees adds significant pressures on a already fragile infrastructure and social structure.  Bangladesh is 89% Muslim so that is one less barrier.  Domestic political environment is polarized and the arrival of so many refugees will be challenging to handle.  Additional social and economic stresses are likely to produce upheaval and possibly violence.
Based on general news and GJP consensus.
Possibility is rising due to the influx of Rohingya refugees that are also getting discriminated in Bangladesh.

Continued flow of refugees into Bangladesh is putting strain on the government's ability to handle.
